definition[0]: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks
example[1]: It might be prudent to get a virus detector for the network.
note[0]: it is prudent (for somebody) to do something
example[2]: These must be prudent loans requiring the buyer to put in significant capital.
definition[1]: following the rule that a business should not state an asset value, possible profit etc to be bigger, or a possible loss to be smaller, than it actually might be
